trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>Abort Copy File</legacyBold> operation aborts a pending <legacyBold>Copy File</legacyBold> operation, and leaves a destination file with zero length and full metadata.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>Abort Copy File</legacyBold> operation aborts a pending <legacyBold>Copy File</legacyBold> operation, and leaves a destination file with zero length and full metadata.

trans-unit.source: The Abort Copy File request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The Abort Copy File request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace the path components shown in the request URI with your own, as follows:
trans-unit.target: Replace the path components shown in the request URI with your own, as follows:

trans-unit.source: The name of your storage account.
trans-unit.target: The name of your storage account.

trans-unit.source: The name of your file share.
trans-unit.target: The name of your file share.

trans-unit.source: The path to the parent directory.
trans-unit.target: The path to the parent directory.

trans-unit.source: For details on path naming restrictions, see <externalLink><linkText>Naming and Referencing Shares, Directories, Files, and Metadata</linkText><linkUri>#_Naming_and_Referencing</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For details on path naming restrictions, see <externalLink><linkText>Naming and Referencing Shares, Directories, Files, and Metadata</linkText><linkUri>#_Naming_and_Referencing</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The following additional parameters may be specified on the request URI.
trans-unit.target: The following additional parameters may be specified on the request URI.

trans-unit.source: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds.
trans-unit.target: The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Setting Timeouts for File Service Operations</linkText><linkUri>#_Setting_Timeouts_for</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Setting Timeouts for File Service Operations</linkText><linkUri>#_Setting_Timeouts_for</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Authentication for the Azure Storage Services.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Authentication for the Azure Storage Services.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Authentication for the Azure Storage Services.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Authentication for the Azure Storage Services.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Versioning for the Azure Storage Services.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Versioning for the Azure Storage Services.

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 204 (No Content).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 204 (No Content).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see Status and Error Codes.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see Status and Error Codes.

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response also includes additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response also includes additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the HTTP/1.1 protocol specification.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the HTTP/1.1 protocol specification.

trans-unit.source: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.
trans-unit.target: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Troubleshooting API Operations.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Troubleshooting API Operations.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the File service used to execute the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the File service used to execute the request.

trans-unit.source: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.
trans-unit.target: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

trans-unit.source: Only the account owner may call this operation.
trans-unit.target: Only the account owner may call this operation.

trans-unit.source: When you abort a pending <legacyBold>Copy File</legacyBold> operation, the destination file’s <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status</parameterReference> header is set to <parameterReference>aborted</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: When you abort a pending <legacyBold>Copy File</legacyBold> operation, the destination file’s <parameterReference>x-ms-copy-status</parameterReference> header is set to <parameterReference>aborted</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: Aborting a copy operation results in a destination file of zero length.
trans-unit.target: Aborting a copy operation results in a destination file of zero length.

trans-unit.source: However, the metadata for the destination file will have the new values copied from the source blob or file or set explicitly in the <legacyBold>Copy File</legacyBold> operation call.
trans-unit.target: However, the metadata for the destination file will have the new values copied from the source blob or file or set explicitly in the <legacyBold>Copy File</legacyBold> operation call.

trans-unit.source: You can only abort a copy operation that is pending.
trans-unit.target: You can only abort a copy operation that is pending.

trans-unit.source: Trying to abort a copy that has completed or failed results in <legacyBold>409 Conflict</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Trying to abort a copy that has completed or failed results in <legacyBold>409 Conflict</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Trying to abort a copy operation using an incorrect copy ID also results in <legacyBold>409 Conflict</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Trying to abort a copy operation using an incorrect copy ID also results in <legacyBold>409 Conflict</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Supported in version 2015-02-21 and above, Optional.
trans-unit.target: Supported in version 2015-02-21 and above, Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the maximum size of the share, in gigabytes.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the maximum size of the share, in gigabytes.

trans-unit.source: Must be greater than 0, and less than or equal to 5TB (5120).
trans-unit.target: Must be greater than 0, and less than or equal to 5TB (5120).

trans-unit.source: The share size quota can be used to limit the size of files stored on the share.
trans-unit.target: The share size quota can be used to limit the size of files stored on the share.

trans-unit.source: It does not limit the size of snapshots.
trans-unit.target: It does not limit the size of snapshots.

trans-unit.source: The overhead associated with files that is used in computing the billing size for the storage account is not accounted for in the quota.
trans-unit.target: The overhead associated with files that is used in computing the billing size for the storage account is not accounted for in the quota.

trans-unit.source: When the sum of the sizes of the files on the share exceeds the quota set on the share, attempts to increase the size of a file will fail, and creating new non-empty files (via REST) will fail.
trans-unit.target: When the sum of the sizes of the files on the share exceeds the quota set on the share, attempts to increase the size of a file will fail, and creating new non-empty files (via REST) will fail.

trans-unit.source: You will still be able to create empty files.
trans-unit.target: You will still be able to create empty files.

trans-unit.source: Changing or setting the quota has no effect on billing.
trans-unit.target: Changing or setting the quota has no effect on billing.

trans-unit.source: You will still be billed for the size of the files plus the overhead.
trans-unit.target: You will still be billed for the size of the files plus the overhead.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the maximum size of the share, in gigabytes.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the maximum size of the share, in gigabytes.

trans-unit.source: Must be greater than 0, and less than or equal to 5TB (5120).
trans-unit.target: Must be greater than 0, and less than or equal to 5TB (5120).

trans-unit.source: For more information on the share quota, see Create Share.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the share quota, see Create Share.

trans-unit.source: Setting the quota below the size of the data on the share will succeed, however you will no longer be able to add data to the share until the size of the data on the share is reduced below the quota either by deleting non-empty files, or shrinking the size of files.
trans-unit.target: Setting the quota below the size of the data on the share will succeed, however you will no longer be able to add data to the share until the size of the data on the share is reduced below the quota either by deleting non-empty files, or shrinking the size of files.

trans-unit.source: PUT https://myaccount.file.core.windows.net/myshare?restype=share&comp=propertiesRequest Headers:x-ms-version: 2015-02-21x-ms-date: Mon, 27 Jan 2015 22:50:32 GMTAuthorization: SharedKey myaccount: Z5043vY9MesKNh0PNtksNc9nbXSSqGHueE00Jdjid0Q=x-ms-share-quota: 55
trans-unit.target: PUT https://myaccount.file.core.windows.net/myshare?restype=share&comp=propertiesRequest Headers:x-ms-version: 2015-02-21x-ms-date: Mon, 27 Jan 2015 22:50:32 GMTAuthorization: SharedKey myaccount: Z5043vY9MesKNh0PNtksNc9nbXSSqGHueE00Jdjid0Q=x-ms-share-quota: 55

trans-unit.source: Returns the current share quota in GB for version 2015-02-21 and above.
trans-unit.target: Returns the current share quota in GB for version 2015-02-21 and above.

trans-unit.source: The size returned in the x-ms-share-size header is the sum of the sizes of the file stored in the share, rounded up to the nearest gigabyte.
trans-unit.target: The size returned in the x-ms-share-size header is the sum of the sizes of the file stored in the share, rounded up to the nearest gigabyte.

trans-unit.source: This may not include all recently created or recently resized files.
trans-unit.target: This may not include all recently created or recently resized files.
